TopicTitle: Are the stock textures free to use?

Articles.Content: It would really help a brand-new aspiring modder to be if they were, especially since I'm currently making a set of Mk2-compatible parts. Obviously I can't use them for other games or anything, just wondering if I can use them for KSP mods.
You should have licensed the textures under the KSP EULA, so you need to abide by it. Of course you can always ask Squad to relicense them to you under a different license.

But... I haven't done anything with any textures yet. I'm asking if I'm allowed to use their textures on my modded models to make parts.

EDIT: And to clarify, I don't mean just using the whole texture, I just want to use the color/gradients and apply them to my parts, with a clone tool and the like.

Edited December 13, 2013 by StaticArcher
Well you can do on your own computer whatever you want. I was assuming that you want to publish those parts afterwards.

Fair enough, and a good point. I was about to ask if I could use them and distribute my mod, but then my question just sort of answered itself upon stumbling through that line of reasoning. Thanks for helping me think, though!
